intro: Cullen tenax, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and somewhat succulent. Cullen tenax thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested habitats.
